snippet: A judge ruled on Friday that court oversight of the mental health care in California prisons remained necessary.
abstract: Federal Judge Lawrence K Karlton rejects California's motion to regain control of mental health care in its prisons, ruling that quality of care failed to meet standards required by Constitution; move deals blow to Gov Jerry Brown's broader efforts to bring prisons back under state's authority.
lead_paragraph: A judge ruled on Friday that court oversight of the mental health care in California prisons remained necessary.

headline.seo: U.S. to Keep Control of Mental Care in California Prisons
headline.main: U.S. Spurns California Move for Greater Say on Prisons
headline.print_headline: U.S. Spurns California Move For Greater Say on Prisons
